page.title: 12FAMILY LIFE IN HAWICK
page.content: In the last fifteen years Hawick clubs and pubs have opened their doors to women, much to the detriment of the once regular family gatherings and weekly 'knitting bees'. The tables have indeed turned since the days of the drunken stockingmakers of the 19th Century when their womenfolk suffered so greatly. Extended licensing hours merely serve to underline the ever increasing number of females, teen- agers to middle-age and beyond, who have invaded the once all male domain to indulge their taste for alcahol. "Women's Rights" have come a long way since the turn of the century but perhaps have not always progressed in the right direction.
